title: PBMC- 02 - CD4+ T cell Isolation from PBMC with “Dynabeads CD4 Positive Isolation Kit”
title_html: PBMC- 02 - CD4+ T cell Isolation from PBMC with “Dynabeads CD4 Positive Isolation Kit”

authors.affiliation: Center for Research in Medical Pharmacology, University of Insubria (Varese, Italy)

source.description: Isolate PBMCs according either to the standard protocol from fresh blood or from buffy coat (PBMC- 01a - Isolation of Human PBMC from Buffy Coat, PBMC- 01b - Isolation of Human PBMC from Whole Blood).

Count the cells with Cellometer machine or by manual count, using either Trypan Blue or Türk solutions accordingly.
For automatic cell count with Cellometer machine use Trypan Blue.
Follow protocol CELL COUNT- 03
For manual cell count use Türk solution for checking purity.
Follow protocol CELL COUNT- 02

source.title: SOLUTION- 09 - Trypan Blue solution

Resuspend Dynabeads in the vial using a vortex for >30 sec.
Transfer the desired volume of Dynabeads to a 5mL-tube (use BD tubes cat. n. 352054) following this proportion: 25µL of beads for 10x106cells.

Add
of Solution- 11 (found in the kit materials as Buffer 1), resuspend and place the tube into the magnet: beads will attach to the magnet very quickly (few seconds).
Discard then the supernatant by using a glass Pasteur pipette.
Remove the tube from the magnet.

source.title: SOLUTION- 11 - CD4+T cells isolation buffer

source.description: Repeat the washing step 2 or 3 times to make sure that DMSO is all washed up.

After counting, centrifuge PBMCs sample at
.

Discard supernatant and resuspend pellet of 10x106 cells in
of SOLUTION- 11.

source.title: SOLUTION- 11 - CD4+T cells isolation buffer

source.description: Transfer cell suspension into the tube with beads, and resuspend vigorously.

Incubate the beads with cells for
at
with gentle rotation by putting the Sample Mixer in the fridge.
After incubation place the tube on the magnet and wait for 1-2 minutes, that is until the complex beads-cells is completely attached to the magnet.
While the tube is still in the magnet, carefully remove and discard the supernatant with a glass Pasteur pipette.

Remove the tube from the magnet, add
of SOLUTION- 11 and resuspend the cells very vigorously because of aggregates.

source.title: SOLUTION- 11 - CD4+T cells isolation buffer

source.description: Repeat steps 11-13 twice (in total 3 times) to wash the bead-bound CD4+ T cells. These steps are critical to obtain a high purity of isolated cells.

Resuspend cell pellet in
of SOLUTION- 07 (found in the kit materials as Buffer 2)
[The volume is calibrated for 10x106 cells, for lower or higher number of cell resize the volume accordingly].

source.title: SOLUTION -07 - RPMI/FBS 1%

source.description:
Add
of DETACHaBEAD® CD4 for each 10x106 PBMCs.
(Resize this volume if the number of starting cell is different)

Add another
of SOLUTION- 07 to increase the volume and transfer everything in a 1.5 mL eppendorf.

source.description:
Incubate
at
(RT) with gentle rotation by using a Sample Mixer.
Transfer the sample from eppendorf to BD tube, and place the tube on magnetand wait for 1-2 mins, that is until the complex beads-cells is completely attached to the magnet.

While the tube is still in the magnet, transfer the supernatant containing the released cells into a 15 mL conical tube.
To obtain residual cells, wash the beads 3 times with
of SOLUTION- 07 and collect the supernatant each time.

source.title: SOLUTION -07 - RPMI/FBS 1%

of SOLUTION- 07: follow the appropriate protocol (see step 2 of this protocol).

source.document: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v234","text":"Trypan Blue solution 0.4%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1o0c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c8i7q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9joa","text":"Prepare a dilution at 0.2%(v\/v): 0.4 mL of Trypan stock solution + 0.6 mL PBS or NaCl (final volume 1mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fsuoh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d8kin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c23gp","text":"Storage: 4\u00b0C in the dark (Prepare fresh every 2 weeks)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":29,"offset":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1kqhv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fg2at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qbng","text":"Trypan blue catalog number: T8154-100mLSigma Italy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ekvmp","text":"This recepe is used in the following protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ebip5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bae3c","text":"- PBMC- 01a - Isolation of Human PBMC from Buffy Coat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9h426","text":"- PBMC- 01b - Isolation of Human PBMC from Whole Blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eadol","text":"- PBMC- 02 - CD4+ T cell Isolation from PBMC with \u201cDynabeads CD4 Positive Isolation Kit\u201d","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4mvil","text":"- PBMC- 03 - TEFF+TREG Isolation from PBMC with \u201cMiltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit\u201d","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c38fg","text":"- PMN- 01a - Isolation of Human PMN from Buffy Coat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b27co","text":"- PMN- 01b - Isolation of Human PMN from Whole Blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9pi2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

OPTIONAL STEP
Check the purity of the isolated CD4+ T cells by flow cytometry.
If needed, check the purity by labeling CD4 with the appropriate CD markers, such as CD3, CD4, CD8 and CD14 Ab and analyze samples with a flow cytometer to exclude the presence of undesired subsets.
EXPECTED RESULTS

source.body:
Cell Viability: ≥95 %
Cell Yield: ± 4,6 x106 cells starting from 25 mL of Fresh Blood
± 6 x106 cells starting from 25 mL of Buffy Coat
If checked, purity of the isolated CD4+ cells must be ≥95 %

description:
List of published works using this protocol:
- Kustrimovic N., Comi C., Magistrelli L., Rasini E., Legnaro M., Bombelli R., Aleksic I., Blandini F., Minafra B., Riboldazzi G., Struchio A., Mauri M., Bono G., Marino F., Cosentino M. Parkinson’s disease patients have a complex phenotypic and functional Th1 bias: cross-sectional studies of CD4+ Th1/Th2/T17 and Treg in drug-naïve and drug-treated patients (2018). Journal of neuroinflammation, 15(1), 205. https://doi.org/10.1186/s12974-018-1248-8
- Kustrimovic, N., Rasini, E., Legnaro, M., Bombelli, R., Aleksic, I., Blandini, F., Comi, C., Mauri, M., Minafra, B., Riboldazzi, G., Sanchez-Guajardo, V., Marino, F., & Cosentino, M. (2016). Dopaminergic Receptors on CD4+ T Naive and Memory Lymphocytes Correlate with Motor Impairment in Patients with Parkinson's Disease. Scientific reports, 6, 33738. https://doi.org/10.1038/srep33738
- Cosentino M., Ferrari M., Kustrimovic N., Rasini E., Marino F. (2015). Influence of dopamine receptor gene polymorphisms on circulating T lymphocytes: A pilot study in healthy subjects. Human immunology, 76, 10, 747-752. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.humimm.2015.09.032
